paragraphs.text:
%md # Introduction to Splice Machine for DBAs This curriculum is recommended for DBAs who are working with Splice Machine. To understand the topics in this section, you need to have experience with databases and be comfortable working with Hadoop. You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this curriculum. Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and most notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web. This is the sequence of notebooks in our *Splice Machine DBAs* class:
1. If you've not already done so, please visit our General Introduction to Splice Machine notebook for an overview of Splice Machine before diving into this set of notebooks.
2. The Notebook Basics notebook is a brief introduction to running and creating/modifying Zeppelin notebooks, which you'll need to know before proceeding with the other notebooks in this section..
3. The Running Queries notebook introduces you to querying your Splice Machine database.
4. The Tuning Queries for Performance notebook introduces a number of tips you can employ to help generate the lowest cost plan and best performance for your queries, including: collecting statistics, compacting, creating primary keys and indexes, and strategies for joining tables.
5. The Using the Database Console UI notebook introduces the dashboard you can use to monitor queries sent to the Spark engine; this allows you to follow the progress of queries running in Spark, monitor GC usage, and terminate queries when necessary.
6. The Using Explain and Hints notebook teaches you how to understand query execution plans and how to use hints to influence execution plans.
7. The The Life of a Query notebook is a more in-depth walk-through of creating, populating, and querying TPCH benchmark data in Splice Machine.
8. The Creating Custom Stored Procedures notebook show you how to create and deploy custom, stored functions and procedures that you can call from your SQL queries in Splice Machine .

msg.data:
Introduction to Splice Machine for DBAs

This curriculum is recommended for DBAs who are working with Splice Machine. To understand the topics in this section, you need to have experience with databases and be comfortable working with Hadoop. You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this curriculum.

Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and most notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web.

This is the sequence of notebooks in our Splice Machine DBAs class:

1. If you've not already done so, please visit our General Introduction to Splice Machine notebook for an overview of Splice Machine before diving into this set of notebooks.
2. The Notebook Basics notebook is a brief introduction to running and creating/modifying Zeppelin notebooks, which you'll need to know before proceeding with the other notebooks in this section..
3. The Running Queries notebook introduces you to querying your Splice Machine database.
4. The Tuning Queries for Performance notebook introduces a number of tips you can employ to help generate the lowest cost plan and best performance for your queries, including: collecting statistics, compacting, creating primary keys and indexes, and strategies for joining tables.
5. The Using the Database Console UI notebook introduces the dashboard you can use to monitor queries sent to the Spark engine; this allows you to follow the progress of queries running in Spark, monitor GC usage, and terminate queries when necessary.
6. The Using Explain and Hints notebook teaches you how to understand query execution plans and how to use hints to influence execution plans.
7. The The Life of a Query notebook is a more in-depth walk-through of creating, populating, and querying TPCH benchmark data in Splice Machine.
8. The Creating Custom Stored Procedures notebook show you how to create and deploy custom, stored functions and procedures that you can call from your SQL queries in Splice Machine .

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Where to Go Next
Please start this class with the [*Notebook Basics*](/#/notebook/2DY5CJ4CS) notebook for a brief introduction to running and creating/modifying Zeppelin notebooks.
